page.title: 07SHEEP FARMING IN LLANBISTER
page.content: A typical year for the Welsh, Beaulah, Speckled and Half bred ewes commences by feeding on good pasture ready for mating in October with Border and Blue Faced Leicesters or Suffolf rams.Supplementary feeding follows in the last six weeks of pregnancy plus a copper boost to protect expected lambs against Swayback.Lambs arrive in the month from mid March.They are drenched at a month old against worms, ear marked, castrated, vaccinated, and tails cut. July ending sees the lambs weaned and fattened on good pasture,ewes go to the hill.Lamb sales start soon, peaking in early November. Dead weight averages between 14 and 17 kilos. In June the ewes are sheared. The year ends with dipping against Scab and drenching against fluke and worm.
